title: Does reading on the smartphone hurt my eyes? If yes, what can be done to avoid this hurt? - Quora

response.answer_text: Using computer/ cell phone/ tablet screens are not very harmful for your eyes as long as you give frequent breaks during usage and use it intelligently. use of LED screens of computers/cell phones/tablets can cause certain ill effects in the form of Computer vision syndrome which comprises of GlareDry eyesEye fatigue due to constant bright light and changing colours on screenProblems with circadian rhythm[1](sleep/wake cycle/ biological clock). This is due to the the blue light which suppresses the normal night time secretion of melatonin- which controls circadian rhythm.after that rest.You prefer Kindle which is made for Reading purpose only How the Kindle helps The kindle helps counteract all the above disadvantages of LED screens by using the e-ink technology and using very less light. The Kindle and other e-ink ebook readers come very close to real paper in user experience. Even the models with light mode like Paperwhite and Voyage have a technology called front-lighting which does not project light directly to your eyes like LED screens (No blue light/no glare). People who read a lot and don't really require colour or graphics are served very well by the kindle- all the models.
